column4: I can get it through other ways but I would like to get it in Device Manager
see whether any of the options listed at hal-device-manager --help helps.
lshw or a gui inside the menus on the top of the screen.
Do you know if their is any way to get the Device Manager to show more information about my system?
q~what about the advanced tab in there?
no that doesn't help, i'm looking more specifically for the name and model number of my hardware
thanks i'll give it ago
probably not, I just read through the options.

I don't suppose you can help me with another problem? when I put in a dvd disk containing mp3 albums Ubuntu wont let me browse it.  When I click it I get took straight to the cd/dvd burning program that comes with Ubuntu
the dvd is empty, it seems, double check it elsewhere
the DVD is definitely not empty, i've checked it on a windows machine
run mount in a termina, and pastebin it.
run mount in a termina, and pastebin it.
ok will do that now
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/6063/
now, ls /media/cdrom0, and show the output of that.
ok doing it now
the items contained on the disk are listed
use nautilus to view them.
yeah nautilus can see them now aswell
nice.
thanks for the help
now any idea how to make it so that the default burning program doesn't automatically come up when I put in a disk?
